document.masterDocTitle: The Pachyprotasis formosana group (Hymenoptera, Tenthredinidae) in China: identification and new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Pachyprotasis formosana group (Hymenoptera, Tenthredinidae) in China: identification and new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
formosana
group

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Thorax red, the mesonotal lateral lobes, most of metanotum and metasternum black; a paired spot on metasternum and a sometimes wanting spot in front on each side of the mesopleura white. Punctures on mesopleura fine, scattered. Burma
....................................................................................................................... P
. rufipleuris
Malaise, 1945

- General color of thorax black, without red; mesonotum and metanotum with yellow-white spots; other white parts are: large L shape spot on middle of mesepisternum, outer side of mesepimeron, pectus. Punctures on mesopleura rather large, distinct. China (Yunnan, Tibet); Burma , India
.............................................. P
. versicolor
Cameron , 1876

4 Apex of antennae white, but ventral side of flagellomere 9 dark brown in the male; white spots on tergites 1–7 discrete; metatibiae black, dorsal part of hind tibia just before apex with white spots. China (Shaanxi) ...........................
............................................................................................................................. P
. fopingensis Zhong & Wei
sp. nov.

- Apex of flagellomere 6 and all of flagellomere 7 black, flagellomere 8 and 9 white; white spots on tergites 1–7 continuous, metatibiae black, without white spot. China (Guizhou); Burma , India
.................. P
. birmanica Forsius, 1936

- Pectus, tergite 3 except laterally red. Face raised into a subpyramidal tubercle exactly between the antennae. Burma
.......................................................................................................................................... P. tuberculata
Malaise, 1945
- Last or last two flagellomeres black, in the male ventral side of antennae sometimes pale or pale brown ................. 9

8 Mesoscutellum without middle furrow; dorsal spots on tergites 2–7 discrete in the female, in the male dorsal spots on tergites confluent; whole of flagellomeres 1– 2 and basal half of flagellomere 3 black in the female, ventral sides of antennomeres 1–5 white in the male; serrulae not flat; punctures on mesepisternum fine, interspaces strongly shining, without microsculpture. China (Guizhou)
.................................................. P
. bicoloricornis
Wei & Nie, 2002

- Top of mesoscutellum with deep middle furrow; spots on dorsal side of tergites 3–7 confluent; ventral sides of flagellomeres 1–4 yellow white; serrulae flat; mesepisternum with distinct microsculpture, punctures minute and shallow. China (Hubei)
................................................................................. P
. maculoannulata Zhong & Wei
sp.nov .

- Flagellomere 1 longer than flagellomere 2 ; punctures on and around frontal area coarse and dense; mesoscutellum pyramidally raised and without sharp lateral carinas, the apex with a broad and shallow, longitudinal incision; metatibiae black, middle part with a broad white ring. China (Sichuan)
....................................... P
. emdeni (
Forsius, 1931
)

10 Punctures on head extremely minute. mesoscutellum entirely pale and lateral ridges also pale; abdomen impunctate; antennae black, antennomeres 3–4 white in the female; scapus and pedicel ventrally, antennomeres 3–5 except dorsal surfaces and basal part of antennomere 6 white in the male, lancet with protruding teeth, middle serrula with 9– 11 posterior sub-basal teeth. China (Zhejinag, Henan, Hunan, Sichuan, Yunnan), Burma , India ..................................
........................................................................................................................................ P
. alboannulata
Forsius, 1935

- Head with large, distinct punctures; mesoscutellum pale except its posterior slope and lateral ridges, which are black; abdomen with distinct, isolated punctures on lateral sides of tergites 3–6 ; apical 3 / 5 of antennomere 3 , antennomeres 4–5 white in the female; lancet with small, indistinct protruding teeth, middle serrula with 19–20 posterior subbasal teeth. India
................................................................................................. P
. sikkimensis
Saini & Kalia, 1989
11 Mesepisternum with broad white band, central part of pectus white ......................................................................... 12

- Flagellomere 1 much longer than flagellomere 2 ; apex of flagellomeres 4 and the last 3 flagellomeres white; mesepisternum with a large longitudinal white band; head shining, the middle area with distinct and dense punctures; punctures on mesepisternum large, distinct and space between punctures with distinct microsculpture. China (Zhejiang, Fujian, Taiwan , Sichuan) ..........................................................................................
P . formosana
Rohwer, 1916

13 Head on and around the frontal area with separate, distinct punctures; surface between the larger punctures with faint microsculpture; the three apical flagellomeres white; a rounded spot of bright rusty-red color extends over most of labrum and the anterior half of clypeus; lancet with strong, protruding teeth. Burma ...............................................
........................................................................................................................................ P. rubribuccata
Malaise, 1945

- Head polished and strongly shining, mostly impunctate, but on some specimens with isolated, hardly visible minute punctures; flagellomeres 4 and 5 white, the two apical ones black; clypeus and labrum white, the anterior margin of clypeus black; lancet with short sparse teeth. India
......................................................... P. multilineata
Malaise, 1945
14 Flagellomere 1 equal to or longer than flagellomere 2 ; hind coxa yellow-white or yellow-brown ........................... 15

- Flagellomere 1 shorter than flagellomere 2 ; hind coxa entirely black; clypeus black except posterolateral sides; head on and around the frontal area with distinct punctures; punctures on upper part of mesepisternum larger and deeper than on head. China (Yunnan)
................................................................................ P. nigricoxis
Zhong & Wei
sp. nov.

15 Apex of flagellomere 4 and the last three flagellomeres white; posterior margins of all tergites white; veins and stigma black-brown; punctures on frontal area deep, distinct; median fovea pit-like. China (Jiangxi, Zhejiang, Fujian, Guangxi, Hunan, Sichuan, Guizhou)
............................................................................. P. nanlingia
Wei, 2006

- Apex of flagellomere 3 , flagellomere 4 except basal half on dorsal side, all of flagellomeres 5–7 white; tergites 1–6 completely black; costa, subcosta, R 1 and base of stigma brown, other part of stigma and remaining veins blackbrown; punctures on frontal area shallow; median fovea absent. China (Hubei) ...........................................................
........................................................................................................................... P
. altantennata Zhong & Wei
sp. nov.
